intro: Adenostemma goyazense, commonly known as the Goyazense false aloe, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in open areas with full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and ecological adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
